headline: Lockheed Scores an Earnings Beat. It Wasn’t Enough for the Stock.
summary: Lockheed  Martin produced the clean quarter investors were hoping for.  Shares of the defense contractor fell anyway on Tuesday .  Wall Street was looking for earnings per share of $6.38 from sales of $18.6 billion, according to FactSet.

headline: Pent-Up Demand Helps Defense Contractors Weather Government Shutdown
summary: The government shutdown has done little to curb defense-contractor profits--at least not yet.  Big weapons suppliers like Lockheed Martin and RTX benefited from surging third-quarter demand for jet fighters, missile systems and other ammunition, prompting them to raise their 2025 profit and sales targets.  Rival Northrop Grumman also boosted its adjusted profit target as executives said the U.S. government shutdown that started this month has yet to threaten the company’s bottom line.

content.title: Pent-Up Demand Helps Defense Contractors Weather Government Shutdown
content.summary: The government shutdown has done little to curb defense-contractor profits--at least not yet.  Big weapons suppliers like Lockheed Martin and RTX benefited from surging third-quarter demand for jet fighters, missile systems and other ammunition, prompting them to raise their 2025 profit and sales targets.  Rival Northrop Grumman also boosted its adjusted profit target as executives said the U.S. government shutdown that started this month has yet to threaten the company’s bottom line.

headline: Lockheed Martin (LMT) Q3 2025 Earnings Transcript
summary: Lockheed Martin Corporation delivered strong operational and financial performance across all four of our business areas in the quarter.  Meanwhile, we are also positioning the company for what we see as even greater demand for the iconic Lockheed Martin Corporation products and systems needed by the U.S. and its allies to ensure deterrence from potential great power armed conflict.  As I have said, Lockheed Martin Corporation is in the aerospace and defense industry but in the deterrence business.

content.title: Lockheed Martin (LMT) Q3 2025 Earnings Transcript
content.summary: Lockheed Martin Corporation delivered strong operational and financial performance across all four of our business areas in the quarter.  Meanwhile, we are also positioning the company for what we see as even greater demand for the iconic Lockheed Martin Corporation products and systems needed by the U.S. and its allies to ensure deterrence from potential great power armed conflict.  As I have said, Lockheed Martin Corporation is in the aerospace and defense industry but in the deterrence business.

headline: Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) Reports Q3 In Line With Expectations
summary: Security and Aerospace company Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 8.8% year on year to $18.61 billion. The company’s outlook for the full year was close to analysts’ estimates with revenue guided to $74.5 billion at the midpoint. Its GAAP profit of $6.95 per share was 9.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) Reports Q3 In Line With Expectations
content.summary: Security and Aerospace company Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 8.8% year on year to $18.61 billion. The company’s outlook for the full year was close to analysts’ estimates with revenue guided to $74.5 billion at the midpoint. Its GAAP profit of $6.95 per share was 9.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Lockheed Martin Raises Full-Year Profit Outlook on Strong Demand
summary: Lockheed Martin  increased its full-year earnings outlook and said it is boosting production as it continues to see strong demand for its defense programs.  The military contractor said Tuesday it now expects earnings per share of $22.15 to $22.35 for the year, up from a prior range of $21.70 to $22.  Analysts polled by FactSet were looking for earnings of $21.91 a share and sales of $74.31 billion.

content.title: Lockheed Martin Raises Full-Year Profit Outlook on Strong Demand
content.summary: Lockheed Martin  increased its full-year earnings outlook and said it is boosting production as it continues to see strong demand for its defense programs.  The military contractor said Tuesday it now expects earnings per share of $22.15 to $22.35 for the year, up from a prior range of $21.70 to $22.  Analysts polled by FactSet were looking for earnings of $21.91 a share and sales of $74.31 billion.

headline: Lockheed Martin Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: Lockheed Martin Corporation [NYSE: LMT] today reported third quarter 2025 sales of $18.6 billion, compared to $17.1 billion in the third quarter of 2024. Net earnings in the third quarter of 2025 were $1.6 billion, or $6.95 per share, compared to $1.6 billion, or $6.80 per share, in the third quarter of 2024. Cash from operations was $3.7 billion in the third quarter of 2025, compared to $2.4 billion in the third quarter of 2024. Free cash flow was $3.3 billion in the third quarter of 2025, comp
